title: Qute: Template extensions regresion in Quarkus 2.10.0
body:
### Describe the bug

The following code works with Quarkus 2.9.x but it is not working with Quarkus 2.10.0

```java

import io.quarkus.qute.TemplateExtension;

import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
import java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor;

@TemplateExtension(namespace = "datetime")
public class DateTimeExtensions {

    public static String formatDate(TemporalAccessor date) {
        return DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss").format(date);
    }
}    
```

```html
<small>{datetime:formatDate(it.creationDate)}</small>
```            

creationDate has type ```java.time.LocalDateTime``` 

If I replace TemporalAccessor with LocalDateTime template extension is working as expected, but now it is not working when I'm using interface in extension method.

### Expected behavior

This extension should be working not only with classes but also with interfaces.

### Actual behavior

Quarkus  is throwing exception

```
{datetime:formatDate(it.creationDate)}: No matching namespace [datetime] extension method found
```



### How to Reproduce?

_No response_
